description: Configuration for basis asset selection from synthetic price data

prices_path.description: Path to the monthly prices CSV file (generated by generate_synthetic_data.py)

weights_path.description: Path to the market index weights CSV file. Assets with positive weights in any month are retained.

distance_computation.description: Parameters for computing distance matrix from prices

min_periods.description: Minimum number of overlapping observations required to compute correlation

shrink_method.description: Covariance/correlation shrinkage method (None for raw, 'lw' for Ledoit-Wolf, 'pca' for PCA denoising)

pca_denoising.description: Parameters for PCA denoising when shrink_method='pca'

pca_n_components.description: Number of PCA components to retain (null = auto-select based on explained_variance)

pca_explained_variance.description: Target explained variance ratio for PCA (0.0 to 1.0). Used if pca_n_components is null.

basis_selection.description: Parameters for basis asset selection. Choose method via 'basis_selection_method'. Supported: 'max_spread', 'max_spread_weighted', 'hub_branch'

basis_size.description: Number of basis assets to select

weight_alpha.description: Trade-off parameter for weighted selection: balances spread vs weight importance (used by max_spread_weighted)

notes.0.5: Balanced: equal emphasis on spread and weight
notes.1.0: Pure spread-based selection (ignores weights, same as standard max-spread)

hub_branch_h.description: Number of hubs for hub_branch (null=auto, integer to override)

hub_branch_weight_gamma.description: Weight blending for hub_branch: 0=centrality only, 1=weight only

output_path.description: Path where the selected basis tickers will be saved

basis_path.description: Path to the basis CSV (used by local_ridge). Can override default location.

file_format.description: Output format for basis selection results

q_neighbors.description: Number of nearest basis neighbors to use per regression (null = use all basis assets)

algorithm.description: MST algorithm to use ('prim' is currently implemented)
